alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 2:25PM CDT until May 27 at 7:55PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Goodland KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...Nebraska... Beaver Creek At Cedar Bluffs affecting Red Willow and Decatur Counties. .Heavy rainfall is causing multiple rivers and creeks to flow over their banks. For the Beaver Creek...including Ludell, Cedar Bluffs...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Beaver Creek At Cedar Bluffs. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Lowland areas in the vicinity of the gage will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 3.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 16.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CDT.
